Detailed Description

InstructionElement is another abstract class derived from Instruction. In represents a primitive unit of packet data that Dissector will interpret, and is a leaf in the Instruction tree.

Pattern roles:

  • Composite::Leaf
  • Iterator::ConcreteAggregate
  • Interpreter::TerminalExpression
  • Observer::Subject

Member Function Documentation

void BabelShark::InstructionElement::Attach ( TypeDefinition *  observer  ) 

Attach is called by DynamicDefinitions who need to watch this Instruction for changes because there is an AliasedInstruction which uses this Instruction's variable as a dynamic type parameter.

Pattern roles:

  • Proxy::Subject::Attach()

Parameters:
observer pointer to observer to attach

void BabelShark::InstructionElement::Interpret ( char *  buffer  )  [virtual]

Interprets incoming packet data. Reads data from buffer and stores interpretation to later be displayed.

void BabelShark::InstructionElement::Notify (  ) 

Notify is called when the Instruction's interpreted value changes, to notify all observers of the change.

Pattern roles:

  • Proxy::Subject::Notify()

unsigned int BabelShark::InstructionElement::NumSubtrees (  )  [virtual]

Returns the total amount of subtree nodes that occur beneath this node. Will be used by Dissector to allocate memory for keeping the expanded state (ett) of subtrees.

Returns:
rounded up number of subtrees below this node

Reimplemented from BabelShark::Instruction.

std::bitset< BIT_MASK_MAX_SIZE > BabelShark::InstructionElement::SetupBitMask ( unsigned int  val  )  [static]

A utility function used to create a bitmask for subtypes to use if they are looking at only a portion of a byte of data.

Parameters:
val number of bits to mask
Returns:
bitmask to reveal val bytes

std::string BabelShark::InstructionElement::SimpleDisplay (  ) 

SimpleDisplay() returns a simplified representations of the element's current interpreted value. Mainly for use in variable references.
